festivals.name: Tomorrowland
festivals.description: One of the world's largest and most iconic electronic dance music festivals, held in Boom, Belgium. Known for its elaborate stage designs and world-class DJ lineups.

festivals.name: Glastonbury Festival
festivals.description: The legendary British festival featuring music, dance, comedy, theatre, and arts. Held at Worthy Farm in Somerset, it's one of the largest greenfield festivals in the world.

festivals.name: Primavera Sound
festivals.description: Barcelona's premier music festival featuring indie, rock, electronic, and experimental artists. Set along the Mediterranean coast at Parc del Fòrum.

festivals.name: Rock am Ring
festivals.description: Germany's biggest rock festival held at the famous Nürburgring racing circuit. Twin festival with Rock im Park, featuring major rock and metal acts.

festivals.name: Roskilde Festival
festivals.description: One of Europe's largest music festivals and the largest in Northern Europe. A non-profit event featuring rock, electronic, hip-hop, and world music.

festivals.name: Sziget Festival
festivals.description: The 'Island of Freedom' festival on Óbuda Island in Budapest. One of Europe's largest cultural festivals with music, art, and performances.

festivals.name: Sonar Festival
festivals.description: Barcelona's International Festival of Advanced Music and New Media Art. Known for cutting-edge electronic music and multimedia exhibitions.

festivals.name: EXIT Festival
festivals.description: Award-winning festival held in the Petrovaradin Fortress. Born from a student movement, it's one of the most unique festival locations in Europe.

festivals.name: Pinkpop
festivals.description: The oldest and one of the largest annual pop and rock music festivals in the Netherlands, held in Landgraaf since 1970.

festivals.name: Hellfest
festivals.description: France's largest metal festival featuring heavy metal, punk, and hardcore acts. Known for its intense atmosphere and impressive stage designs.

festivals.name: Lollapalooza Berlin
festivals.description: The European edition of the famous American festival, held at the historic Olympiastadion grounds in Berlin with diverse musical acts.

festivals.name: Mad Cool Festival
festivals.description: Madrid's major international music festival featuring rock, indie, and electronic artists in the Valdebebas area.

festivals.name: Lowlands
festivals.description: A Travelling Feast' - a Dutch festival combining music, film, comedy, and visual arts. Known for its diverse lineup and creative atmosphere.

festivals.name: Melt Festival
festivals.description: Unique festival set in an open-air industrial museum in Ferropolis. Known for electronic and indie music with stunning industrial backdrops.

festivals.name: NOS Alive
festivals.description: Portugal's biggest music festival held along the Tagus River in Lisbon. Features international rock, indie, and electronic acts.

festivals.name: Open'er Festival
festivals.description: Poland's largest open-air music festival in Gdynia. Features international headliners and emerging artists across multiple genres.

festivals.name: Flow Festival
festivals.description: Helsinki's urban festival known for its emphasis on sustainability and eclectic lineup of indie, electronic, and soul music.

festivals.name: Way Out West
festivals.description: Gothenburg's eco-friendly festival in Slottsskogen park. Known for diverse music programming and strong environmental commitment.

festivals.name: Øya Festival
festivals.description: Oslo's premier urban festival in the medieval park Tøyenparken. Celebrated for its environmental sustainability and quality music curation.

festivals.name: Electric Castle
festivals.description: Unique festival set in the domain of Banffy Castle in Transylvania. Combines music with art installations in a magical setting.

festivals.name: Untold Festival
festivals.description: Romania's biggest electronic music festival held in Cluj-Napoca. Features world-renowned DJs and spectacular stage productions.

festivals.name: Pukkelpop
festivals.description: One of Belgium's largest music festivals held in Hasselt. Features rock, hip-hop, electronic, and alternative music.

festivals.name: Wacken Open Air
festivals.description: The world's largest heavy metal festival held in the small village of Wacken, Germany. A pilgrimage site for metalheads worldwide.

festivals.name: Download Festival UK
festivals.description: The UK's premier rock and metal festival at Donington Park. Successor to Monsters of Rock, featuring legendary headliners.

festivals.name: Isle of Wight Festival
festivals.description: Historic British festival revived in 2002. Famous for hosting legendary acts since the 1960s including Hendrix and The Who.

festivals.name: Reading Festival
festivals.description: One of the oldest popular music festivals in the world. Twin festival with Leeds, known for launching rock careers.

festivals.name: Leeds Festival
festivals.description: Twin sister to Reading Festival, held simultaneously in Bramham Park. Major rock and alternative music celebration.

festivals.name: Creamfields
festivals.description: The UK's biggest dance music festival in Cheshire. Features the world's top DJs across multiple massive stages.

festivals.name: TRNSMT Festival
festivals.description: Glasgow's major music festival on Glasgow Green. Urban festival featuring rock, pop, and indie acts.

festivals.name: Wireless Festival
festivals.description: London's premier urban music festival featuring hip-hop, grime, R&B, and electronic acts in Finsbury Park.

festivals.name: We Love Green
festivals.description: Eco-conscious Parisian festival in Bois de Vincennes. Combines music with environmental activism and sustainability.

festivals.name: Rock en Seine
festivals.description: Paris's major rock festival held in the Domaine National de Saint-Cloud. Features international and French rock acts.

festivals.name: Les Vieilles Charrues
festivals.description: France's largest music festival in Brittany. Eclectic lineup spanning rock, pop, electronic, and world music.

festivals.name: Main Square Festival
festivals.description: Major French festival in the Citadelle d'Arras. Features international headliners across rock, pop, and electronic.

festivals.name: Solidays
festivals.description: Paris charity festival supporting AIDS research. Three days of music at the Hippodrome de Longchamp.

festivals.name: Dour Festival
festivals.description: Belgian festival known for its eclectic programming from punk to techno. Underground atmosphere with affordable tickets.

festivals.name: Graspop Metal Meeting
festivals.description: Belgium's biggest heavy metal festival in Dessel. Four days of metal mayhem with top international acts.

festivals.name: Rock Werchter
festivals.description: Premier Belgian rock festival consistently ranked among Europe's best. World-class production and diverse lineup.

festivals.name: Couleur Café
festivals.description: Brussels' urban world music festival celebrating diversity. Features reggae, hip-hop, afrobeat, and global sounds.

festivals.name: North Sea Jazz Festival
festivals.description: One of the world's largest indoor jazz festivals in Rotterdam. Features jazz, soul, funk, and world music legends.

festivals.name: Defqon.1
festivals.description: The world's largest hardstyle festival at Walibi Holland. Extreme sound systems and passionate hardcore fans.

festivals.name: Awakenings Festival
festivals.description: Amsterdam's legendary techno festival in Spaarnwoude. Pure techno with world's best underground artists.

festivals.name: Dekmantel Festival
festivals.description: Amsterdam's cutting-edge electronic music festival. Focuses on underground house, techno, and experimental sounds.

festivals.name: Hurricane Festival
festivals.description: Twin festival to Southside, held in Scheeßel. Major German rock and alternative music event.

festivals.name: Southside Festival
festivals.description: Southern Germany's major rock festival near Lake Constance. Twin to Hurricane with identical lineup.

festivals.name: Splash! Festival
festivals.description: Germany's biggest hip-hop festival at Ferropolis. Features international and German rap, R&B, and urban music.

festivals.name: Nature One
festivals.description: One of Europe's largest electronic music festivals on former military grounds. Non-stop music for 30+ hours.

festivals.name: Parookaville
festivals.description: German EDM festival creating a fictional city at Weeze Airport. Immersive experience with elaborate theming.

festivals.name: SonneMondSterne
festivals.description: Long-running German electronic festival at Bleilochtalsperre lake. Known for beautiful setting and quality techno.

festivals.name: Full Force Festival
festivals.description: German metal and hardcore festival at Ferropolis. Features extreme music from metalcore to death metal.

festivals.name: FIB Benicàssim
festivals.description: Iconic Spanish festival on the Mediterranean coast. Four days of indie, electronic, and rock by the beach.

festivals.name: Bilbao BBK Live
festivals.description: Basque Country's biggest festival on Mount Cobetas overlooking Bilbao. Rock and indie with stunning views.

festivals.name: Resurrection Fest
festivals.description: Spain's largest heavy metal festival in Galicia. Major international metal acts in a passionate atmosphere.

festivals.name: Medusa Festival
festivals.description: Spanish beach EDM festival near Valencia. Features top electronic acts on the Mediterranean coast.

festivals.name: Cruïlla Barcelona
festivals.description: Barcelona's urban summer festival at Parc del Fòrum. Eclectic mix of rock, pop, electronic, and world music.

festivals.name: Low Festival
festivals.description: Alicante's indie festival with amazing Mediterranean weather. Features national and international indie acts.

festivals.name: Super Bock Super Rock
festivals.description: Portuguese festival near Lisbon at Meco beach. Major rock and alternative acts in a coastal setting.

festivals.name: MEO Sudoeste
festivals.description: Portugal's beach festival in Zambujeira do Mar. Week-long party combining music with stunning Alentejo coast.

festivals.name: Vodafone Paredes de Coura
festivals.description: Portuguese indie festival in a natural river beach amphitheater. Known for its unique setting and quality curation.

festivals.name: Rock in Rio Lisboa
festivals.description: European edition of the legendary Brazilian festival. Massive production with global rock and pop superstars.

festivals.name: Gods of Metal
festivals.description: Italy's premier heavy metal festival near Milan. Features legendary and emerging metal acts.

festivals.name: I-Days Milano
festivals.description: Milan's major rock festival at MIND Milano Innovation District. International headliners in Italy's music capital.

festivals.name: Firenze Rocks
festivals.description: Florence's rock festival at Visarno Arena. Major rock and metal acts in the heart of Tuscany.

festivals.name: Kappa FuturFestival
festivals.description: Turin's industrial techno festival at Parco Dora. Post-industrial setting with cutting-edge electronic music.

festivals.name: Umbria Jazz
festivals.description: One of the world's most important jazz festivals in historic Perugia. Ten days of jazz in medieval streets.

festivals.name: Lucca Summer Festival
festivals.description: Series of concerts within Lucca's Renaissance walls. Iconic setting for international superstars.

festivals.name: Montreux Jazz Festival
festivals.description: Legendary Swiss jazz festival on Lake Geneva since 1967. Intimate venues with world-class artists.

festivals.name: Paléo Festival
festivals.description: Switzerland's largest open-air festival in Nyon. Diverse lineup from rock to world music near Lake Geneva.

festivals.name: Street Parade
festivals.description: Zurich's massive techno parade and Europe's largest. Million attendees dance through the city streets.

festivals.name: Frequency Festival
festivals.description: Austria's largest music festival in St. Pölten. Major rock, hip-hop, and electronic acts.

festivals.name: Donauinselfest
festivals.description: World's largest open-air music festival (free entry) on Vienna's Danube Island. Millions attend annually.

festivals.name: Nova Rock
festivals.description: Austria's biggest rock festival near the Hungarian border. Four days of rock and metal legends.

festivals.name: Electric Love Festival
festivals.description: Austrian EDM festival in the Alps at Salzburgring. Electronic music with stunning mountain scenery.

festivals.name: Pohoda Festival
festivals.description: Slovakia's biggest music festival at Trenčín Airport. Eclectic lineup with strong commitment to arts and culture.

festivals.name: Colours of Ostrava
festivals.description: Czech festival in a former ironworks industrial site. Unique post-industrial setting with diverse music.

festivals.name: Rock for People
festivals.description: Czech Republic's largest rock festival in Hradec Králové. International and Czech rock acts.

festivals.name: Metronome Prague
festivals.description: Prague's urban festival at Výstaviště exhibition grounds. Music, art, and gastronomy in the capital.

festivals.name: Off Festival
festivals.description: Polish alternative music festival in Katowice. Known for adventurous booking and discovering new talent.

festivals.name: Audioriver
festivals.description: Polish electronic music festival on the Vistula River beach. Techno and house with riverside vibes.

festivals.name: Woodstock Poland (Pol'and'Rock)
festivals.description: One of Europe's largest free rock festivals. Draws hundreds of thousands for rock and metal.

festivals.name: Balaton Sound
festivals.description: Hungarian beach festival at Lake Balaton. Electronic music on the shores of Central Europe's largest lake.

festivals.name: VOLT Festival
festivals.description: Hungarian festival in Sopron near the Austrian border. Diverse music from rock to electronic.

festivals.name: Sea Star Festival
festivals.description: Croatian seaside festival in Umag. EXIT Festival's sister event on the Adriatic coast.

festivals.name: INmusic Festival
festivals.description: Croatian rock festival on Zagreb's Lake Jarun island. International rock acts in a unique island setting.

festivals.name: Ultra Europe
festivals.description: European edition of Miami's Ultra Music Festival. Three days of EDM in beautiful Split.

festivals.name: Hideout Festival
festivals.description: British-run beach festival on Croatia's Pag Island. House and bass music at Zrće Beach.

festivals.name: Sonus Festival
festivals.description: Croatian techno festival on Pag Island's Zrće Beach. Underground electronic music 24 hours a day.

festivals.name: Dimensions Festival
festivals.description: Croatian festival for underground electronic music. Deep house, techno, and bass in intimate settings.

festivals.name: Sea Dance Festival
festivals.description: Montenegrin beach festival at Jaz Beach near Budva. EXIT Festival's Adriatic sister event.

festivals.name: Lovefest
festivals.description: Serbian electronic festival in Vrnjačka Banja spa town. Techno and house in a wellness resort setting.

festivals.name: Arsenal Fest
festivals.description: Serbian rock festival in Kragujevac's former military complex. Rock and alternative in industrial setting.

festivals.name: Meadows in the Mountains
festivals.description: Boutique Bulgarian festival in the Rhodope Mountains. Electronic and world music in stunning nature.

festivals.name: Midalidare Rock
festivals.description: Bulgarian rock festival at Midalidare Estate winery. Rock and metal with fine wines in Thracian Valley.

festivals.name: Positivus Festival
festivals.description: Latvia's biggest music festival in Salacgrīva. Indie and alternative on the Baltic coast.

festivals.name: Tallinn Music Week
festivals.description: Estonian showcase festival across Tallinn venues. Emerging artists and music industry conference.

festivals.name: Granatos Live
festivals.description: Lithuania's largest open-air music festival near Vilnius. International pop and rock headliners.

festivals.name: Provinssi
festivals.description: Finnish rock festival in Seinäjoki since 1979. Mix of international and Finnish rock and pop.

festivals.name: Ruisrock
festivals.description: One of Europe's oldest rock festivals on Ruissalo island, Turku. Finnish festival tradition since 1970.

festivals.name: Tuska Open Air
festivals.description: Helsinki's urban metal festival at Suvilahti. Finnish and international metal in the capital.

festivals.name: Bergenfest
festivals.description: Norwegian festival at Bergen's medieval Bergenhus Fortress. Music with fjord views.

festivals.name: Tons of Rock
festivals.description: Oslo's hard rock and metal festival at Ekebergsletta. Heavy music with city skyline views.

festivals.name: Hovefestivalen
festivals.description: Norwegian festival on Tromøy island. Beach camping with diverse musical acts.

festivals.name: Bråvalla Festival
festivals.description: Major Swedish festival in Norrköping. Diverse lineup from hip-hop to rock.

festivals.name: Sweden Rock Festival
festivals.description: Scandinavia's biggest rock festival in Sölvesborg. Classic rock and metal legends.

festivals.name: Summerburst
festivals.description: Swedish EDM festival in Stockholm and Gothenburg. Top international DJs kick off summer.

festivals.name: Copenhell
festivals.description: Danish metal festival in Copenhagen's Refshaleøen. Four days of heavy metal mayhem.

festivals.name: Smukfest
festivals.description: Denmark's second largest festival in Skanderborg's beech forest. Known as 'The Beautiful Festival'.

festivals.name: NorthSide Festival
festivals.description: Danish festival in Aarhus. Rock and indie with sustainable focus.

festivals.name: Iceland Airwaves
festivals.description: Reykjavik's showcase festival across city venues. Discover Icelandic and international artists.

festivals.name: Secret Solstice
festivals.description: Iceland's midnight sun festival in Reykjavik. Music under 24-hour daylight.

festivals.name: Body & Soul Festival
festivals.description: Irish boutique festival at Ballinlough Castle. Arts, wellness, and electronic music.

festivals.name: Electric Picnic
festivals.description: Ireland's largest arts and music festival at Stradbally Estate. Diverse lineup and family-friendly.

festivals.name: Longitude Festival
festivals.description: Dublin's urban music festival in Marlay Park. Hip-hop, pop, and electronic focus.

festivals.name: All Together Now
festivals.description: Irish festival at Curraghmore Estate. Music, arts, and spoken word in historic grounds.

festivals.name: Ejekt Festival
festivals.description: Athens' major rock festival at Plateia Nerou. International headliners by the sea.

festivals.name: Rockwave Festival
festivals.description: Greek rock festival at TerraVibe Park near Athens. Major rock and metal acts.

festivals.name: Release Athens
festivals.description: Series of concerts at Athens' Plateia Nerou. Major international artists over multiple days.

festivals.name: ADE - Amsterdam Dance Event
festivals.description: World's largest electronic music conference and festival. 2,500+ artists across 200 venues.

festivals.name: Melt! Banana
festivals.description: Vienna's experimental electronic festival. Cutting-edge sounds in Austrian capital.

festivals.name: Snowbombing
festivals.description: Austrian ski resort festival in Mayrhofen. Electronic music meets Alpine skiing.

festivals.name: Eurosonic Noorderslag
festivals.description: European showcase festival in Groningen. Industry conference discovering new talent.

festivals.name: SXM Festival
festivals.description: French Riviera electronic music festival. House and techno on the Mediterranean.

festivals.name: Spring Break Amsterdam
festivals.description: Amsterdam's Easter electronic festival. Club nights across the city.

festivals.name: Mácháč Festival
festivals.description: Czech lakeside EDM festival at Máchovo Jezero. Dance music on the beach.

festivals.name: Let It Roll
festivals.description: World's biggest drum and bass festival in Czech Republic. Three days of bass music.
